newsitem.title: BELGIUM: AEA air cargo shows dip in 96 N Atlantic traffic.
newsitem.headline: AEA air cargo shows dip in 96 N Atlantic traffic.

text.p: The Association of European Airlines (AEA) said 1996 air cargo traffic rose by 4.3 percent to 23,525.8 RTKs with volume increases in most markets except for the North Atlantic trade.
AEA spokesman David Henderson said: "It has not been a brilliant year for freight, with the North Atlantic trade being very weak."
North Atlantic business fell slightly by 1.1 percent, to 8,273.9m RTKF for 1996, compared to the previous year, the AEA said in a statement.
Europe to North Africa and the Middle East was the sector with the strongest growth, increasing by 16.9 percent to 1,027.3m RTFK.
Henderson added that for the first time, the Europe-Far East trade sector was the largest, taking over from the North Atlantic.
Generally, the cargo market continues to be highly variable, he said.
*These figures relate to the international scheduled services of AEA member airlines.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
